Unlocking PR Packages as a Small Influencer

In 2025, companies are sending PR packages to small influencers (1K–50K followers) to leverage their 3–6% engagement rates, driving authentic buzz. From beauty to tech, brands like Glossier and Google gift products worth $50–$500 to creators. This guide reveals top companies sending PR packages, hacks to get noticed, and how Newcollab connects you to brands directly.

PR packages spark organic content, with 74% of consumers buying after influencer recommendations (Forbes, 2024). Benefits for small influencers:

  • Free Products: Receive $50–$500 items like makeup or tech.
  • Brand Exposure: Get featured on brand pages.
  • Paid Deals: PR often leads to paid collabs ($100–$2,000).

Top Companies Sending PR Packages

Here are 10 brands actively sending PR packages to small influencers in 2025:

  1. Glossier: Sends minimalist beauty kits with handwritten notes. Tag @glossier, use #glossierpink.
  2. Rare Beauty: Gifts inclusive makeup with mental health messaging. Share self-love content, tag @rarebeauty.
  3. Drunk Elephant: Offers clean skincare in reusable cases. Create eco-focused posts, tag @drunkelephant.
  4. Sephora: Sends diverse beauty products via Sephora Squad. Apply at sephorasquad.com, tag @sephora.
  5. Daniel Wellington: Gifts watches with discount codes. Join Icons program, tag @danielwellington.
  6. ASOS: Sends curated fashion drops. Post with #ASSEENONME, tag @asos.
  7. HelloFresh: Ships meal kits with recipe cards. Share cooking content, tag @hellofresh.
  8. Poppi: Sends prebiotic sodas with branded merch. Create fun reels, tag @drinkpoppi.
  9. Fabletics: Offers activewear for inclusive creators. Use #fableticspartner, tag @fabletics.
  10. Google: Gifts tech like Pixel phones to creators. Post tech tutorials, apply at developer.google.com.

1. Optimize Your Profile for Brands

Brands scan profiles for alignment. Hacks:

  • Define Your Niche: Focus on beauty, fitness, or food.
  • Highlight Engagement: Add '4% Engagement' to bio.
  • Post Consistently: Aim for 500+ views per post.

Newcollab's profile tools showcase your metrics to brands.

2. Create Content That Attracts PR

Stand out with high-quality content. Tips:

  • Showcase Products: Post tutorials or unboxings.
  • Use Hashtags: #PRPackage or brand-specific tags.
  • Engage Followers: Ask questions to boost comments.

Newcollab's ad slots let brands see your content style instantly.

3. Find the Right Brands

Target brands open to small creators. Hacks:

  • Research Hashtags: #MicroInfluencerPR or #BrandCollab.
  • Check Brand Pages: Look for micro-influencer posts.
  • Use Newcollab: Browse 1,000+ brands seeking PR partners.

Avoid mass emails—focus on niche brands like Rare Beauty.

4. Pitch for PR Packages

Effective pitches get you noticed. Tips:

  • Personalize: Mention brand campaigns (e.g., 'Inspired by #RareImpact').
  • Show Value: Highlight 3K+ monthly views.
  • Be Clear: Request PR for content creation.

5. Build Long-Term Relationships

Turn PR into paid deals. Hacks:

  • Follow Up: Thank brands via email after posting.
  • Deliver Quality: Create reels with 1K+ views.
  • Stay Engaged: Comment on brand posts.

faq.question: Which companies send PR packages to small influencers?
faq.answer: Companies like Glossier, Rare Beauty, Sephora, HelloFresh, and Google actively send PR packages to small influencers (1K–50K followers) in 2025. These brands value micro-influencers for their high engagement rates and authentic content.

faq.question: How much are PR packages worth for small influencers?
faq.answer: PR packages for small influencers typically range from $50–$500 in value, depending on the brand and products included. Some packages may also include tech items like phones or premium products worth even more.

faq.question: How do small influencers get PR packages?
faq.answer: Small influencers can get PR packages by creating quality content, using relevant hashtags, engaging with brands on social media, and using platforms like Newcollab that connect them directly with brands seeking collaborations.

faq.question: What should I include when pitching for PR packages?
faq.answer: Include your follower count, engagement rate, content examples, media kit, and specific reasons why you're a good fit for the brand. Personalization and showing genuine interest in their products is key to getting responses.

faq.question: Can PR packages lead to paid collaborations?
faq.answer: Yes! PR packages often lead to paid collaborations worth $100–$2,000. Brands use PR to test the waters with influencers, and successful partnerships frequently result in ongoing paid work and long-term relationships.
